meanings.definition: Lying or resting on something else
meanings.sent1: The heavy box was superincumbent on the fragile table.
meanings.sent2: The blanket was superincumbent on the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy puppy found the superincumbent pillow quite cozy.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were superincumbent, threatening rain.
meanings.sent5: The superincumbent snow on the roof sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Exerting pressure or weight from above
meanings.sent1: The superincumbent rock made the bridge creak under its weight.
meanings.sent2: The superincumbent tree branches swayed in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The superincumbent pile of books looked ready to topple over.
meanings.sent4: The superincumbent silence in the room was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The superincumbent pressure of the water caused the dam to crack.

meanings.definition: Occupying a higher position or rank
meanings.sent1: The superincumbent manager made all the important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The superincumbent officer led the troops into battle.
meanings.sent3: The superincumbent student always sat at the front of the class.
meanings.sent4: The superincumbent queen ruled over the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The superincumbent mountain peak offered a breathtaking view of the valley below.
